TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SKPath extends SkiaSharp.SKObject

Docs.summary: A compound geometric path.
Docs.remarks: A path encapsulates compound (multiple contour) geometric paths consisting of straight line segments, quadratic curves, and cubic curves.

MemberSignature.Value: public SKPath ();
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an empty path.

MemberSignature.Value: public SKPath (SkiaSharp.SKPath path);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class SkiaSharp.SKPath path) cil managed

Docs.param: The path to clone.
Docs.summary: Creates a path by making a copy of an existing path
Docs.remarks: This constructor can throw InvalidOperationException if there is a problem copying the source path.

Docs.param: The bounds of oval used to define the size of the arc.
Starting angle (in degrees) where the arc begins.
Sweep angle (in degrees) measured clockwise.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified arc to the path as a new contour.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddPath (SkiaSharp.SKPath other, SkiaSharp.SKPath.AddMode mode);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddPath(class SkiaSharp.SKPath other, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPath/AddMode mode) cil managed

Docs.param: The path containing the elements to be added to the current path.
Determines how the path contours are added to the path. On mode, contours are added as new contours. On mode, the last contour of the path is extended with the first contour of the path.
Docs.summary: Extends the current path with the path elements from another path, using the specified extension mode.

Docs.summary: Extends the current path with the path elements from another path, using the specified extension mode.

Initial point of the contour (initial ), expressed as a corner index, starting in the upper-left position, clock-wise. Must be in the range of 0..3.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ArcTo (SkiaSharp.SKPoint point1, SkiaSharp.SKPoint point2, float radius);
.method public hidebysig instance void ArcTo(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPoint point1, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPoint point2, float32 radius) cil managed

Docs.param: The corner coordinates.
The destination coordinates.
The corner radius.
Docs.summary: Appends a line and arc to the current path.
Docs.remarks: This is the same as the PostScript call "arct".

MemberSignature.Value: public void ArcTo (SkiaSharp.SKRect oval, float startAngle, float sweepAngle, bool forceMoveTo);
.method public hidebysig instance void ArcTo(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKRect oval, float32 startAngle, float32 sweepAngle, bool forceMoveTo) cil managed

Docs.param: The bounding oval defining the shape and size of the arc.
The starting angle (in degrees) where the arc begins.
The sweep angle (in degrees) measured clockwise.
Whether to always begin a new contour with the arc.
Docs.summary: Appends the specified arc to the path.
Docs.remarks: If the start of the arc is different from the path’s current last point, then an automatic is added to connect the current contour to the start of the arc. However, if the path is empty, then we call with the first point of the arc.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ArcTo (SkiaSharp.SKPoint r, float xAxisRotate, SkiaSharp.SKPathArcSize largeArc, SkiaSharp.SKPathDirection sweep, SkiaSharp.SKPoint xy);

Docs.param: The radius.
The angle in degrees relative to the x-axis.
Determines whether the smallest or largest arc possible is drawn.
Determines if the arc should be swept in an anti-clockwise or clockwise direction.
The destination coordinate.
Docs.summary: Appends an elliptical arc from the current point in the format used by SVG.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKRect Bounds { get; }
.property instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKRect Bounds

Docs.summary: Gets the bounds of the path's points. If the path contains zero points/verbs, this will return the empty rectangle.
Docs.value: Gets the bounds of the path's points.
Docs.remarks: This bounds may be larger than the actual shape, since curves do not extend as far as their control points. Additionally this bound encompases all points, even isolated MoveTo either preceeding or following the last non-degenerate contour.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Close ();
.method public hidebysig instance void Close() cil managed

Docs.summary: Closes the current contour.
Docs.remarks: If the current point is not equal to the first point of the contour, a line segment is automatically added.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKRect ComputeTightBounds ();
.method public hidebysig instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKRect ComputeTightBounds() cil managed

Docs.summary: Computes a bounds that is conservatively "snug" around the path.

remarks.para: This assumes that the path will be filled.
It does not attempt to collapse away contours that are logically empty (e.g. MoveTo(x, y) + LineTo(x, y)) but will include them in the calculation.

The coordinates of the end point of the conic curve.
The weight of the conic curve.
Docs.summary: Add a conic path from the last point.
Docs.remarks: If no call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0, 0).

The coordinates of the end point of the conic curve.
The weight of the conic curve.
The tolerance to use (1 << pow2).
Docs.summary: Chop a conic into a number of quads.
Docs.returns: Returns the collection of points that make up the conic curve.
Docs.remarks: The amount of storage needed for pts is: 1 + 2 * (1 << pow2)

The tolerance to use (1 << pow2).

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKPathConvexity Convexity { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPathConvexity Convexity

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the path's convexity.
Docs.remarks: If it is currently unknown, then this function will attempt to compute the convexity (and cache the result).

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKPath.Iterator CreateIterator (bool forceClose);
.method public hidebysig instance class SkiaSharp.SKPath/Iterator CreateIterator(bool forceClose) cil managed

Docs.param: When this is true, each contour (as defined by a new starting move command) will be completed with a close verb regardless of the contour's contents.
Docs.summary: Creates an iterator object to scan the all of the segments (lines, quadratics, cubics) of each contours in a path.
Docs.returns: Returns an object that can be used to iterate over the various elements of the path.
Docs.remarks: This iterator is able to clean up the path as the values are returned. If you do not desire to get verbs that have been cleaned up, use the method instead.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKPath.RawIterator CreateRawIterator ();
.method public hidebysig instance class SkiaSharp.SKPath/RawIterator CreateRawIterator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a raw iterator object to scan the all of the segments (lines, quadratics, cubics) of each contours in a path.
Docs.returns: Returns an object that can be used to iterate over the various elements of the path.
Docs.remarks: Unlike the method, this iterator does not clean up or normalize the values in the path. It returns the raw elements contained in the path.

The coordinates of the 2nd control point on a cubic curve.
The coordinates of the end point on a cubic curve.
Docs.summary: Adds a cubic bezier from the last point.
Docs.remarks: If no call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0, 0).

Docs.remarks: If no call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0, 0).

MemberSignature.Value: public bool GetBounds (out SkiaSharp.SKRect rect);
.method public hidebysig instance bool GetBounds([out] valuetype SkiaSharp.SKRect& rect) cil managed

Docs.param: The bounds, if the path contains any points.
Docs.summary: Returns the bounds of the path's points.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the path is not empty, otherwise false.
Docs.remarks: This bounds may be larger than the actual shape, since curves do not extend as far as their control points. Additionally this bound encompases all points, even isolated MoveTo either preceeding or following the last non-degenerate contour.

Docs.remarks: If the index is out of range (i.e. is not 0 <= index < ), then the returned coordinates will be (0, 0).

Docs.summary: Gets all the points in the path.
Docs.remarks: The number of points will be , To only return a subset of the points in the path, use .

MemberSignature.Value: public void QuadTo (SkiaSharp.SKPoint point0, SkiaSharp.SKPoint point1);
.method public hidebysig instance void QuadTo(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPoint point0, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPoint point1) cil managed

Docs.param: The coordinates of the control point on a quadratic curve.
The coordinates of the end point on a quadratic curve.
Docs.summary: Add a quadratic bezier from the last point.
Docs.remarks: Add a quadratic bezier from the last point, approaching control point (point0), and ending at point1. If no call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0, 0).

MemberSignature.Value: public void QuadTo (float x0, float y0, float x1, float y1);
.method public hidebysig instance void QuadTo(float32 x0, float32 y0, float32 x1, float32 y1) cil managed

Docs.param: The x-coordinate of the control point on a quadratic curve.
The y-coordinate of the control point on a quadratic curve.
The x-coordinate of the end point on a quadratic curve.
The y-coordinate of the end point on a quadratic curve.
Docs.summary: Add a quadratic bezier from the last point.
Docs.remarks: Add a quadratic bezier from the last point, approaching control point (x0, y0), and ending at (x1, y1). If no call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0, 0).

Docs.param: The radius.
The angle in degrees relative to the x-axis.
Determines whether the smallest or largest arc possible is drawn.
Determines if the arc should be swept in an anti-clockwise or clockwise direction.
The destination coordinates relative to the last point.
Docs.summary: The same as , but the coordinates are considered relative to the last point on this contour.

The destination x-coordinate relative to the last point.
The destination y-coordinate relative to the last point.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Reset ();
.method public hidebysig instance void Reset() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clear any lines and curves from the path, making it empty.
Docs.remarks: This frees up internal storage associated with those segments.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Rewind ();
.method public hidebysig instance void Rewind() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clear any lines and curves from the path, making it empty.
Docs.remarks: Any internal storage for those lines/curves is retained, making reuse of the path potentially faster.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKPathSegmentMask SegmentMasks { get; }
.property instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPathSegmentMask SegmentMasks

Docs.summary: Gets a set of flags indicating if the path contains one or more segments of that type.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKPath Simplify ();
.method public hidebysig instance class SkiaSharp.SKPath Simplify() cil managed

Docs.summary: Return a simplified copy of the current path.
Docs.returns: Returns the new path if simplification was successful, otherwise null.
Docs.remarks: The curve order is reduced where possible so that cubics may be turned into quadratics, and quadratics maybe turned into lines.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Simplify (SkiaSharp.SKPath result);
.method public hidebysig instance bool Simplify(class SkiaSharp.SKPath result) cil managed

Docs.param: The path to store the simplified path data. If simplification failed, then this is unmodified.
Docs.summary: Simplifies the current path.
Docs.returns: Returns true if simplification was successful, otherwise false.
Docs.remarks: The curve order is reduced where possible so that cubics may be turned into quadratics, and quadratics maybe turned into lines.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKRect TightBounds { get; }
.property instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKRect TightBounds

Docs.summary: Gets the “tight” bounds of the path. Unlike , the control points of curves are excluded.
Docs.value: The tight bounds of the path.

MemberSignature.Value: public string ToSvgPathData ();
.method public hidebysig instance string ToSvgPathData() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a SVG path data representation of the current path.
